title: Family-owned Foxhills turns 40
text:
15:30 Three Golf course, four pools, 11 tennis courts, healthspa in the heart of Surrey Family-owned Foxhills Club & Resort turns 40 this year in time to celebrate being ranked in Golf World’s Top 100 Golf Courses in England and winning Professional Beauty Residential Spa of the Year. Located 20 minutes from Heathrow and just five minutes from J11 of the M25, the picturesque 400-acre four-star Surrey estate is open to Members and Non-members. 
Foxhills offers options for individual, family and corporate memberships. Members enjoy the Bernard Hunt and Longcross championship golf courses; the par-three nine hole Manor course; access to 11 tennis courts with pro coaches; and the healthspa with its state-of-the-art fitness centre and over 40 weekly classes. Members may also take advantage of regular events for children, an on-site soft play area and crèche, and swimming lessons. Foxhills welcomes Non-member guests who find 70 elegantly appointed and notably spacious suites and bedrooms. In addition to their own private outdoor pool, guests enjoy breakfast in The Manor Restaurant and take full advantage of the healthspa. Jason Adams, Foxhills’ General Manager, said: “When you leave Foxhills, you feel better than when you arrived. It’s that simple. The allure of Foxhills, which has been Surrey’s playground since 1975, is our world-class facilities cosseted in the Surrey countryside.” Set within the magnificent 19th century Manor House, The Manor Restaurant boasts two AA Rosettes with menus by Executive Head Chef Alan O’Kane that showcase the finest British ingredients. The Orangery - an elegant private dining room with Terrace access and views of the grounds - provides the perfect setting for a special occasion. Nineteen is a brasserie-style restaurant, whilst the Clubhouse is an event space particularly popular with bridal parties due to its scenic location. The family-friendly Summerhouse restaurant is exclusive to Members and hotel residents: parents can relax with full visibility of the private walled area, pool, splash pool and adventure playground. The healthspa offers an indoor pool; a natural outdoor pool in the spa garden – the only one at a UK hotel; an outdoor Jacuzzi; a Scandinavian-themed thermal area; fitness suite including a new Kinesis wall; and, of course, restful treatment rooms. For guests in Surrey on business, Foxhills is an ideal setting for corporate events from four to 160 delegates, product launches, conferences, and team-building adventures. Resort facilities including the par-three Manor golf course; the healthspa; and the tennis courts and pools are available as part of a range of packages. Related articles
